intro: Rondeletia longipetiolata, commonly known as the long-petioled rondeletia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its slender, climbing stems and clusters of small, fragrant white or pink flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a velvety texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical and subtropical regions.
